bio: I find the process of creating deeply rewarding. I am in my element when  engaged in deep work on a meaningful project. Through this process, if I am able to master a hard thing (or at least improve by a little bit) I feel on top of the world. Beyond all else, I value creatively producing high quality code solutions. Code modularity, reusability, efficiency, readability, and testability are considerations at the forefront of my mind each time I sit down at the keyboard. In my free time I stay active, practice mindfulness meditation, and geek out over Myers-Briggs.

projects.description: As the owner of Ballet Body by Jasmin, a beginning ballet program for adults, I am both the developer and consumer of my software products. I created <>Student Portal</> out of a need to provide my ballet students with a convenient way of purchasing classes and reviewing a list of their purchase history.
projects.techDescription: Student Portal is a full stack, responsive web application. This app utilizes a MongoDB database, Node server with Express, React and Redux for the user interface, JSON Web Tokens for authentication, and Stripe API for payment processing.

projects.description: Ballet Body by Jasmin is a beginning ballet program for adults. This project is an informational website for the business.
On Join Class, users (ballet students) can sign up for ballet class, view the schedule of classes, and cancel any current reservations.

I love a good quote, especially when I happen upon one serendipitously and it makes my day. A fun API hack, this responsive web application integrates with two third-party APIs: Tumblr and FavQ's. The user starts with entering their Tumblr username, then selects a text post from their Tumblr feed. Quotumblr chooses a random word from the selected post, then using FavQ's API, returns a quote containing that word.
